summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between officials at the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The emails discuss coordinating to ensure SDNY prosecutors on the Epstein team have access to relevant Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) information held by FinCEN.

persons.name: Assistant Chief Counsel Financial Crimes Enforcement Network
persons.context: The sender/author of several emails in the chain, representing FinCEN's counsel and facilitating the sharing of SAR information with SDNY prosecutors.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Money Laundering and Transnational Criminal Enterprises Unit Asset Forfeiture Coordinator United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
persons.context: The individual who initiates the coordination by connecting FinCEN counsel with the AUSAs on the Epstein team to share SAR information.

connections.person1: Assistant Chief Counsel Financial Crimes Enforcement Network
connections.person2: Co-Chief, Money Laundering and Transnational Criminal Enterprises Unit Asset Forfeiture Coordinator United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
connections.description: Professional colleagues coordinating the transfer of financial intelligence (SARs) related to the Epstein investigation from FinCEN to the SDNY prosecution team.

events.title: Initial Coordination Email
events.description: A prosecutor from SDNY emails FinCEN counsel to introduce and connect them with AUSAs on the Epstein team to coordinate on SAR information.
personsInvolved: Co-Chief, Money Laundering and Transnational Criminal Enterprises Unit Asset Forfeiture Coordinator United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
Assistant Chief Counsel Financial Crimes Enforcement Network

events.title: FinCEN Confirms Information Sharing
events.description: FinCEN counsel confirms they have information (SARs) to send to the SDNY Epstein prosecution team and copies an Intelligence Division contact for direct liaison.
personsInvolved: Assistant Chief Counsel Financial Crimes Enforcement Network

keyFacts: The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) possessed Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) related to Jeffrey Epstein that were relevant to the SDNY prosecution.

In August 2019, there was active coordination between FinCEN counsel and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to ensure prosecutors on the 'Epstein team' received this financial intelligence.
The email chain indicates the SAR information was not necessarily already in the possession of the SDNY prosecutors, necessitating a direct handoff.
The correspondence is marked as potentially containing privileged information, highlighting the sensitive nature of the financial investigation.
